place.name: BESTWOOD
place.gazetteerText: BESTWOOD HALL, a farmhouse 4½ miles N of Nottingham; on a tract of 3,700 acres, once a royal domain and deer-park, but now under cultivation. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
